fields.summary: VMware: imager *still* fails to install grub

comments.body: We did managed to do some testing on a system that manifest this behavior consistently, and we discovered that the small 1.3G image booted properly, while a bigger image (more than 4G) didn't.

[~chuck] created a script to mimic what euca-imager does, but added a 4th partition at the beginning to contain the /boot directory. With this trick, we managed to get grub to do its job on an image that was failing before.

Based on the latest test, it seems like when the stage files are copied in the /root partition, they end up pretty far off inside the partition in a region that GRUB cannot access (or claim it can't access). The solution would be to create a 100MB partition at the beginning of the disk between MBR and /root where the /boot/* data will reside. This should allow GRUB to be able to access these files at all time since they would always be in the early sectors of the disk.

Working on implementing this solution at the moment.
Got the changes to work :). Need to run seq01 test overnight to sanitize everything. If all good, I should be able to give something in the morning to test with.
Code implemented based on 3.2. Commit done under the team/clc-dev/BROKER-20 branch. Test euca_imager provided to CS for CentOS/RHEL 5.8 and 6.3.

As I mentioned to [~chuck] in person, I have reservations regarding addition of {{NC_RESOURCE_BOOT}} to {{ncResourceType}}, since all other elements of that enum are shared between CLC and the back end components (by being part of the VirtualBootRecord API). If it is possible to avoid adding that value, it would be desirable from software engineering perspective. That said, since there may be some refactoring of the VBR API in the medium-term future, I am not opposed to committing this fix as is and reworking everything later.

After review with [~dmitrii] we agreed that the current change will work for 3.2.2 and a better approach should be designed for 3.3.0. BROKER-26 has been opened to keep track of the 3.3 necessary changes.

[~chuck] or [~dmitrii]

Can you guys provide the easiest method to reproduce? What are the regression areas to focus on?

Basically, [~chuck] has implemented a better way to create a bootable disk in the imager. We are quite confident that it solves the problem in this ticket, though testing that is difficult. (The problem is sensitive to timing or disk layout or both.)

So, yeah, the main things to test for are regressions. I would say some combination of

* churn (different key, so imager is always involved)
* EMIs of different size (Linux ones, of course)
* VM Types of different size (since that changes the layout of partitions)

Should do the trick. The more the merrier. I'd say at least 5 different variations to feel fuzzy about this.

Thanks [~dmitrii]. I totally forgot to add the test recommendation. Another thing to do is to make sure that, inside the instance, another partition "/boot" has been created that points to another device.

Actually, if fdisk is pointer at the device (e.g. /dev/sda):
